question: [File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/mmt_v3/sources/version.move] [Function: is_supported_major_version()] [Return Value Semantics] is_supported_major_version() returns bool but what defines 'supported'? Could ambiguous semantics lead to security vs. feature support confusion, where unsupported major versions are allowed? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/mmt_v3/sources/version.move] [Struct: Version] [Shared Object Mutation] Version has key+store abilities, suggesting it should be a shared object. Without proper synchronization in upgrade functions, could concurrent version updates from multiple operators create race conditions? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/mmt_v3/sources/version.move] [Struct: Version] [UID Exposure] Version exposes its UID publicly. Could malicious code delete or manipulate the Version object ID, causing version checks across the protocol to fail permanently? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/mmt_v3/sources/version.move] [Struct: Version] [Store Ability Risk] Version has store ability, allowing it to be placed in collections. Could an attacker create fake Version objects in their own storage, then pass them to functions expecting the canonical shared Version? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/mmt_v3/sources/version.move] [Struct: VersionCap] [Capability Transfer] VersionCap has key+store abilities, making it transferable. If multiple VersionCaps exist or the cap is stolen, could unauthorized parties upgrade the protocol version, breaking compatibility? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/mmt_v3/sources/version.move] [Struct: Version] [Version Overflow] major_version and minor_version are u64. Could repeated upgrades overflow these values (2^64 - 1), causing version comparison logic to break or wrap around to 0? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/mmt_v3/sources/version.move] [Struct: Version] [Version Underflow] If version comparison logic exists elsewhere, could u64 subtraction (new_version - old_version) underflow if versions are somehow decremented, causing incorrect compatibility checks? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/mmt_v3/sources/version.move] [Struct: VersionCap] [Capability Destruction] VersionCap has no explicit drop ability. If the cap is lost or its owner's account is inaccessible, could version management become permanently frozen? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/mmt_v3/sources/version.move] [Struct: Version] [Field Visibility] major_version and minor_version are not explicitly public. Are they accessible outside the module? If not, how do other modules check versions without calling the aborting getter functions? (Medium)
